selectedVerses.text: You shall treat the stranger who sojourns with you as the native among you, and you shall love him as yourself, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
But if you no longer delight in her, you shall let her go where she wants. But you shall not sell her for money, nor shall you treat her as a slave, since you have humiliated her.
Do not rebuke an older man but encourage him as you would a father. Treat younger men like brothers,
He shall treat him as a servant hired year by year. He shall not rule ruthlessly over him in your sight.
But they said, "Should he treat our sister like a prostitute?"
